meanings.definition: The quality of being brisant or explosive.
meanings.sent1: The brisances of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The brisances of the bomb caused widespread destruction.
meanings.sent3: The brisances of the firecracker startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The brisances of the explosion echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The brisances of the dynamite left a lasting impact on the landscape.

meanings.definition: The power of an explosive material to shatter or fragment surrounding objects.
meanings.sent1: The brisances of the grenade scattered debris everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The brisances of the minefield made crossing the area dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The brisances of the firework display amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The brisances of the blast tore through the building like a tornado.
meanings.sent5: The brisances of the explosion left a chaotic scene in its wake.

meanings.definition: The ability of an explosive to produce a shock wave.
meanings.sent1: The brisances of the detonation created a powerful wave of energy.
meanings.sent2: The brisances of the bomb blast could be felt miles away.
meanings.sent3: The brisances of the fireworks show thrilled the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The brisances of the impact reverberated through the ground.
meanings.sent5: The brisances of the explosion rippled through the air with force.
